rules: Rule1: If the guard has access to the gallery, then the museum is secure.
Rule2: Whenever the painting is authentic, the artwork is verified for authentication.
Rule3: Either the painting is authentic or the sculpture is a forgery.
Rule4: If the sculpture is a forgery, then under the condition that the director approves conservation, the guard has access to the gallery.
Rule5: Provided that the policy is conflicting, the rule is enforced.
Rule6: Either the policy is conflicting or, whenever the guard does not have access to the gallery, the curator does not have access to the gallery.
Rule7: If the dispute is resolved, then under the condition that the policy is conflicting, the rule is not enforced.
Rule8: Whenever the security system is authorized for art removal, the cameras are recording.
Rule9: If the security system is authorized for art removal, then surveillance is not active.

Rule10: Either the security system is authorized for art removal or, if it is not the case that the guard not having access implies the curator not having access, then the visitor does not have access to the gallery.
Rule11: Under the condition that the alarm system is functional, the security system is not authorized for art removal.
Rule12: If the cameras are recording, then surveillance is active.
Rule13: Provided that the conservator has a permit for work, the guard has access to the gallery.
Rule14: Either the conservator has a permit for work or the director approves conservation.
Rule15: If it is not the case that the guard not having access implies the curator not having access, then the visitor has access to the gallery.
Rule16: If the guard does not have access to the gallery, then the curator has access to the gallery.
facts: Fact2: The alarm system is functional.
Fact3: It is not the case that the artwork is verified for authentication.
